name: 亞洲管理實務專題
description:
This course is designed to provide an overview of various aspects of doing business and operational management in China, Taiwan, Japan and Vietnam. The course is broadly divided into three parts. 
1.	The first part of the course defining globalization and international business.
2.	The second parts deals with business context and business management. These two parts provide the overview the macro environment economies of China, Taiwan, Japan and Vietnam, including the economy and culture, that affect business and management practices in each country. 
Such overview equips students with a firm basis to be able to analyze the key environmental factors that directly affect how business is conducted in those economies. 
3.	The third part emphasizes on the practical aspects of doing business in each country - China, Taiwan, Japan and Vietnam. Those business opportunities and challenges facing foreign companies and business and management practices so students will gain an in-depth understanding of how to do business in those countries. 
In addition to broad knowledge of the region, assignments and projects will give students opportunities to further develop expertise in a selected country of his/her choice
goals: know the key trends shaping the business environment of the Asia-Pacific region
basic brief knowledge of the economic history and current economic situation in China, Taiwan, Japan and Vietnam
know the conceptual issues related to the Asia-Pacific marketing perspective
To become familiar with many of the major industries and companies in China, Taiwan , Vietnam and Japan
know regulatory business instruments and practices in selected Asia-Pacific states
To understanding of the business environment in China, Taiwan, Vietnam and Japan
know USA’s positions in the Asia-Pacific region from the business perspective
To recognize how management and cross cultural differences affect and impact on the ways of doing business in China, Taiwan, Vietnam and Japan
know critical questions raised and discussed during the course and relevant to building a successful business strategy in the Asia-Pacific region
10.　To gain a working level of competence for engaging in international business activities in China, Taiwan, Vietnam and Japan with business people from these countries

grading.note:
Individual Case Study Write-up & Team Assignment  : (30 %) 
-	Individual student will be assigned 2 business cases study and answer the questions attached for the case , Each one needs to submit case study write up before that case class discussion session starts. ( 20%)
-	Each team will be assigned to complete B2C Solution Proposal and need to submit the proposal at session #14.( 10% )
Active participate class discussion and provide insightful observation and contribution to the class sharing.
Students will fail this class if he/she has 2 or more serious late attendance (10 mins) or absence.

Group Presentation Assignment: (60%)   
-	5 Students will be formed as one group and complete one group assignment.
-	Each team will present their proposal of Asia Pacific globalization plan
-	Group presentation evaluation criteria will be divided into 3 parts: 
	Content Value (20%), 
	Team Work Spirit (20%) 
	and Presentation Skill (20%)
